thread.title: Election 2016: Potential running mates & the competition for supporters
thread.title_full: Election 2016: Potential running mates & the competition for supporters - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Election 2016: Potential running mates & the competition for supporters
text:
Image 1 of / 13 13 Gov. Scott Walker
Walker was originally considered by many of the Republican Party as a serious contender for the position of president of United States until he abruptly ended his campaign on September 21, 2015 - and the race for his supporters commenced
Gov. Scott Walker
Walker was originally considered by many of the...
Image 2 of 13 U.S Senator Ted Cruz Shortly after Gov. Walker's exit, Senator Cruz gained many of Walker's supporters in the states of Georgia, Nevada and Iowa.
U.S Senator Ted Cruz Shortly after Gov. Walker's exit, Senator Cruz...
Image 3 of 13 U.S. Senator Marc Rubio
Another Republican candidate that benefited from Walker's exit was Senator Rubio who obtained many of Scott Walker's supporters from New Hampshire.
U.S. Senator Marc Rubio
Another Republican candidate that benefited... Image 4 of 13 Former Texas Gov. Rick Perry
The same redistribution of supporters happened when Rick Perry dropped out early in September . However in this case, his supporters didn't show a direct transfer like Walker's did. His followers, and their monetary contributions, were disbursed among the remaining GOP candidates.
Former Texas Gov. Rick Perry
The same redistribution of supporters...
Image 5 of 13 U.S. Senator Rand Paul
Now the attention has gravitated to who will leave the race next and it's not looking good for Senator Paul. The latest polls put him at the bottom with a 2% support margin. His supporters could potentially gravitate toward a more grass-roots orientated candidate like Ben Carson. He is the only candidate close to dethroning Trump from the lead.
U.S. Senator Rand Paul
Now the attention has gravitated to who will... Image 6 of 13 Former U.S Secretary of State Hillary Clinton
There is no doubt that the Clinton name packs a punch, and this is clearly showcased in Hillary Clinton's lead in the Democratic party. While the Democratic National Convention is still over a year away and she has not be chosen as the nominee, speculations of who she would select as her running mate has surfaced.
Former U.S Secretary of State Hillary Clinton
There is no doubt... Image 7 of 13 Housing and Urban Development secretary Julian Castro
The 40 year old, Hispanic politician is a top contender to join the Clinton ticket . His youth would provide a boost to Clinton's campaign and his heritage will help her connect to the Latino vote, a highly coveted demographic during this election. Only time will tell if the speculations surrounding these rumors come true.
Housing and Urban Development secretary Julian Castro
The 40...
Image 8 of 13 Vice President Joe Biden
Many sources claim that Vice President Biden is on the verge of announcing his candidacy for president , and a big name is circulating as his potential successor.
Vice President Joe Biden
Many sources claim that Vice President... Image 9 of 13 U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren
The name on the vice president ticket next to Biden could be Senator Warren. Even though she has not openly given her support to any candidate on the Democratic party, many suggest that she could be Vice President Biden's top pick.
U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren
The name on the vice president ticket... Image 10 of 13 U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders
The Democratic party is "feeling the burn" of the meteoric rise of this self-identifying Democratic socialist who has proven that he is a force to be reckoned with in the early stages of this election. Who can keep up with his high energy and middle-class orientated campaign? Elizabeth Warren, yes - social media seems to like the idea of a Sanders/Warren ticket and the two do agree on many issues.
U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders
The Democratic party is "feeling the... Image 11 of 13 GOP candidate Donald Trump
Trump's antics have carried themselves into his running mates dialog. He recently declared that he would love to have Oprah on the ticket , but at this point Kanye West seems to be more appropriate.
Photo: Charlie Neibergall, STF GOP candidate Donald Trump
Trump's antics have carried themselves... Image 12 of 13 Dr. Ben Carson
While the rest of the GOP candidates have remained quiet about their running mate short list due to how early in the race we still are, Carson recently mentioned that he would not be opposed to try a Trump/Carson ticket stating, "anything can happen."
Dr. Ben Carson
While the rest of the GOP candidates have remained... Image 13 of 13 Election 2016: Potential running mates & the competition for supporters 1 / 13 Back to Gallery The next President of United States will not be elected until November 2016, but we have already witnessed a never ending e-mail controversy , the piqued interest of non-traditional politicians in the White House and a candidate who has sensationalized the race with his relentless insults .
As the year winds down, the presidential campaign trail has only intensified and after the departure of GOP candidates Scott Walker and Rick Perry , some of the main focus has turned to their supporters and where they will go now that they are left without a candidate.
Another big topic of conversation also appears to be, who will the remaining candidates selected as their running mate and ultimately become the next Vice President.
While we are still in the early stages of this long race, some have already begun to speculate.
Take a look at some of the predictions and developments in the race for the White House in the slideshow above.
